tasks.task: Garlic harvesting and planting in California.
subtasks: Garlic is harvested by hand in the Gilroy region.
Immigrant workers bend under the sun to pull garlic bulbs.
Garlic bulbs are cleaned and sorted on-site.
Mechanical planting using specialized garlic planters.
Planters distribute garlic cloves evenly in prepared soil.
Planting multiple hectares quickly and efficiently.

tasks.task: Immigrant labor contribution to garlic farming.
subtasks: Immigrant workers are essential for hand harvesting garlic.
Workers come from countries like Mexico, Guatemala, El Salvador, and Honduras.
Many immigrants work under the H-2A Agricultural Visa Program.
Living conditions are often crowded and makeshift.
Labor involves dawn-to-dusk work, bending, pulling, cleaning, and sorting.
Physical demands lead to exhaustion, back pain, and blisters.
Wages are average but wages after deductions are low, limiting savings.

tasks.task: Agriculture technology in garlic farming.
subtasks: Garlic harvesting is primarily done by hand but improving with machinery.
Planting efficiency has been improved by mechanical planters.
Large-scale farming benefits from technological advancements.
